intro: Dendrophyllanthus comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of trees and shrubs. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, white or yellowish berries that are dispersed by birds. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its parasitic nature, it can affect the health of its host plants if left unchecked.
